sub_title: Consultant Meteorology and Climate Change | Environmental Data Analyst | Trainer | MSc Climate Studies and Meteorology
summary:
I am passionate about driving sustainable development in the field of climate adaptation and food security. With my expertise in meteorology and programming, I am especially keen about providing tailored and reliable information to farmers in rain-fed agriculture.

As a consultant for meteorology and climate change at Weather Impact, I am working on projects in the Global South and the Netherlands that entail products from nowcasting and flooding alerts to seasonal outlooks, climate projections, and agro-weather tools. As a consultant and product developer, I make sure to turn complex meteorological data into actionable and reliable advice for farmers so that they can adapt their operations in the field.

Some highlights of my work are the development of crop suitability maps for farmers in Myanmar based on climate and soil parameters and developing an agro-weather tool that gives advice on farming practices - depending on the crop, the growth stage, and more - to farmers in Lesotho and Zimbabwe. Over the past years, I have advanced my Python programming and GIS skills to be able to build such products in my daily work. Currently, I am also working on building my expertise in Machine Learning to improve agro-weather services.

The aspect of sustainability is very important to me. This includes that agronomic advice is always tailored to the context of the respective project location based on the input of local partners and that preferably practices of climate smart and conservation agriculture are promoted. Furthermore, I find it important that every project has a capacity building dimension so that services can ultimately be managed and maintained locally. Thus, I am thankful that I could gain experience in giving on-site and digital trainings in programming and the development and interpretation of agro-weather tools within some of our projects in Sub-Saharan Africa. These trainings are mostly aimed at high-level institutions like the national meteorological agencies, agricultural ministries, and other relevant parties. 

Lastly, I am actively engaged in project acquisition to ensure the continuation of ongoing projects and build new partnerships. I enjoy exchanging ideas and working towards a real-world implementation. If you are interested in my work or partnering with Weather Impact for a project, please do not hesitate to contact me.

profile_positions.description: As a consultant for Meteorology and Climate Change, I manage and execute projects in Sub-Saharan Africa and South-East Asia. The main countries I am working in / have worked in are Zimbabwe, Lesotho, South Africa, and Myanmar. Within these projects I can utilize and accelerate my programming skills (mainly Python) and agro-meteorological knowledge to build mobile and digital advisory services for smallholder farmers. Products that I have built and/or worked on are farming advisories (e.g., when to plant, weed, fertilize), seasonal outlooks, weather forecasts and nation-wide crop suitability maps. To make sure that this information reaches the end-users, in this case smallholder farmers, we employ dissemination methods ranging from SMS to apps and chatbots. Next to building digital services, I have given on-site trainings in Sub-Saharan Africa on agro-weather tools and programming in Python to government officials from the Met-Office and agricultural ministries, as well as, other experts. Lastly, I have been the project lead of a couple of projects due to my excellent time management, organisational skills and sense of responsibility.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Meteorology and Climate Change

profile_positions.description: I am part of the KickStart Fund team that is informing about and distributing a fund that was given from the Dutch government for social and career-related student activities in times of corona. We make sure that the criteria are well defined and communicated to students and student associations, check their proposals and assess the reports of their activities.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant KickStart Fund Student Life

profile_positions.description: Within the MSc Climate Studies programme, I focussed on Meteroology, modelling, and applied meteorology in mostly the agricultural field. I took courses like 'Atmospheric Modelling', 'Atmospheric Dynamics', 'Climate Smart Agriculture', 'Earth System Modelling', and more to enhance my knowledge. I learned to especially enjoy programming and modelling so that I also made sure during my thesis and internship to further develop these skills. During my studies, I used the WRF model to analyse a heavy precipitation event in Jakarta, Indonesia, and to model wildfires and the moisture characteristics in pyrocumulus clouds during my internship. I wrote my MSc Thesis at the chair group 'Meteorology and Air Quality' and 'Water Systems and Global Change' with the title 'Enhancing hydro-climate services for smallholder farmers in the Global South by combining indigenous and scientific weather forecasts'. The innovative character of the thesis led a lot of recognition: - My work work was 1/3 theses being nominated for the Folkert Hellinga Award 2022 - Best Pitch award for environmental thesis within the Folkert Hellinga Award 2022 - 1st NVBM MSc thesis prize 2022; Nederlandse Vereniging ter Bevordering van de Meteorologie (Dutch Association for the advancment of Meteorology)
profile_positions.title: MSc Student Climate Studies (specialisation: meteorology)

company.name: NCAR - The National Center for Atmospheric Research

profile_positions.company: NCAR - The National Center for Atmospheric Research
profile_positions.description: During my remote internship at NCAR, I studied the moisture characteristics of pyrocumulus clouds that evolve above wildfires. Due to its high relevance in combatting wildfires, this work got a lot of recognition. Consequently, I got invited to the headquarters of the Bomberos (firemen of Catalunya) in Barcelona to present my research.
profile_positions.title: Internship about modelling pyro cumulus clouds above wildfires with WRF-fire

profile_positions.company: IAAS (International Association of Students in Agricultural and Related Sciences)
profile_positions.description: As part of this committee, I organised exchanges and welcomed other IAAS members from all around the world in the Netherlands. Part of those exchanges are agriculture- or food-related symposia, visits of farms and companies, as well as cultural events.
profile_positions.title: IAAS Netherlands committee member

profile_positions.company: IAAS (International Association of Students in Agricultural and Related Sciences)
profile_positions.description: IAAS Netherlands is one out of more than 150 committees worldwide. It is part of IAAS world which promotes the exchange of knowledge in the agricultural field, as well, as intercultural exchange. IAAS stands for international association of students in agriculture and related sciences.
profile_positions.title: National Director (and founder) of IAAS Netherlands

profile_positions.company: IAAS (International Association of Students in Agricultural and Related Sciences)
profile_positions.title: Social media manager of IAAS world

profile_positions.description: As both President and Vice-President of the organisation, I learned how to lead an international team and grow the organisation, not only in numbers but also in cohesion and external recognition, including building a coherent organisational structure and setting up recurring events that ensure the longevity and long-lasting impact of the organisation. During my term, I could bring my intercultural communication, organisational, leadership, presentation, and other skills to a much higher level. This was the perfect addition next to my studies to develop a broad set of soft skills already before entering the job market.
profile_positions.title: President of ISOW (International Student Organisation Wageningen)

profile_positions.description: ISOW is the international student organisation of Wageningen (The Netherlands). We are one of the biggest student associations in Wageningen and promote cultural exchange, organise several language and cultural courses like dance classes, and plan activities and excursions for our members.
profile_positions.title: Vice President of ISOW (International Student Organisation of Wageningen)

profile_positions.description: I worked in the restaurant Gullfosskaffi in Iceland during the summer 2015. It is located next to the so-called golden waterfall and I worked both in the restaurant and in the souvenirshop.
profile_positions.title: Waitress and shop assistant
